job.title: Senior SDET, Performance
job.description: ltstronggtltugtAbout UsltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtBlueOwl is a separate company in the State Farm family of companies and the solutions provider for HiRoad Insurance an InsurTech brand that recognizes and rewards good choices Operating independently with the backing of the 1 auto insurer in the country we blend the best aspects of a tech startup and an industry leader To see what weve helped build so far check out HiRoadcom ltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtOur VisionltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtAt BlueOwl we envision a world where data driven behavior fuels better lives We started with the reinvention of insurance and a bold mission to create a data science powered platform that actually helps people become better drivers We aspire to be the best in the business at identifying lowrisk drivers by harnessing the power of data with an innovative technology stackltbrgtltbrgtIts a big goal and thats where you come in Were growing a world class team of data science engineering design product marketing and mobile technologists because we know that the key to success isnt just about nailing the technologyits hiring the talented people who will help us make a quantifiable impactltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtResponsibilitiesltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtDesign and implement solutions to evaluate and improve performanceltligtltligtDevelop performance test plans based on deep understanding of domain architecture and product tech stackltligtltligtDesign implement and maintain performance test frameworksltligtltligtDesign and implement relevant simulators to ingest large dataltligtltligtCollaborate with crossfunctional stakeholders providing testing insights and coming up with innovative solutions to improve and ensure the performance of our product and debugging performance problemsltligtltligtRoot cause performance issues and contribute to product code to alleviate these issuesltligtltligtSupport extended teams in troubleshooting problems such as system malfunctionsltligtltligtProvide feedback propose solutions and suggest improvements in the productltligtltligtDeploy and manage AWS instances to orchestrate the scale and performance testing pipelineltligtltligtTrack test results as queryable time series data and alert upon failure in an automated fashionltligtltligtSupport test failure troubleshooting in various relevant pipelinesltligtltligtSupport troubleshooting of customer reported performance bugs and close the test coverage loopltligtltligtOther duties as assignedltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtMinimum Qualificationsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligt5 years of experience in software engineering focusing on performance testingltligtltligt2 years of experience leading and mentoring performance engineersltligtltligt3 years of analytical and programming skills Python Javascript bashltligtltligt1 years of docker skills and K8s experienceltligtltligt3 years of AWS ecosystem and open source toolsltligtltligtStrong written and verbal communication skills and ability to lead discussionsltligtltligtExcellent troubleshooting skills and great attention to detailltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtPreferred QualificationsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtGitlabGitHub actions CICD experience is a plusltligtltligtK6 experience is a plusltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtAdditional DetailsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtSalary We pay competitive salaries factoring in experience skill set and location We do not offer equityltligtltligtWe provide a wideselection of health and welfare benefits including medical dental vision life insurance and supplemental income plans We also offer a 401k Plan with a company matchltligtltligtWellness and Time Off We provide Headspace subscriptions a wellness allowance and generous time off including four weeks of PTO in the first year of employment with additional time granted upon hire New parents may also take eight weeks of fully paid parental leave plus four weeks for parents who give birth which may be taken within one year after the birth andor the adoption of a childltligtltligtProfessional learning and growth We provide a generous allowance each year for professional learning continuing education and career developmentltligtltligtLocation May work from anywhere in the US but will need to be actively available during core meeting hours from 900AM  300PM pacific time to collaborate with team members across all time zones ltligtltligtSome travel may be required after the San Francisco office reopensltligtltligtCandidates based in the SF Bay Area will be able to commute to the SF office for inperson meetings and other gatherings Frequency TBD ltbrgtltligtltulgtltemgtBlueOwl LLC is an equal opportunity workplace We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction recordsltbrgtltbrgtltemgtltemgtIf you are a San Francisco resident please read the City and County of San Franciscos Fair Chance Ordinance notice
